intro: Genetyllis pinifolia, commonly known as the pineleaf genetyllis, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of western North America. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and needle-like leaves. The plant thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its growth habit is typically low and sprawling, forming dense mats that help prevent soil erosion. Genetyllis pinifolia is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats.
